series.description: Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe in Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews not out 52 (96b 1x4 2x6 114m) SR: 54.16
Upul Tharanga lbw b Utseya 43 (56b 6x4 0x6 99m) SR: 76.78

dismissalComment.html: lands it outside off and gets it to come in with the angle, he is a little lazy on the forward defense and hence fails to get his bat behind the line of the ball, he's hit in line with the offstump, another bowling change works and it's the captain himself

headshotImage.caption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the bowling change works! Absolutely plumb, it lands on a good length on middle and off and straightens, he shapes to whips it to the on side but the ball clips the flap of the back pad, very easy decision

Jayawardene's miserable run against Zimbabwe continues, the ball lands just a shade outside off and forces him to play at it, he gets a thick outside edge and Taibu dives low to his right and pouches it comfortably

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: It's a double-strike for Rainsford, he gets it to come back in off the pitch and Kapugedera gets a half stride forward to defend, he stands outside his crease but the ball does enough to hit him in line with the stumps, Enamul Haque Moni raises the finger

headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Mubarak takes his chances soon after taking the Powerplay, he gives him the charge and scoops it high over mid-on but fails to get the desired elevation to clear the boundary and Williams takes it easily and falls to his right after taking the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c Masakadza b Chigumbura 22 (30b 3x4 1x6 42m) SR: 73.33

dismissalComment.html: loose shot and Jayasuriya is very frustrated with himself, he chases a wide delivery swinging away and the ball clips the toe of his bat and travels to Masakadza at first slip who takes it over his head, terrible shot after hitting him for six

dismissalComment.html: terrible shot really, he commits to the front foot and tries to slog him across the line very early, the ball shoots through and hits the middle and leg stumps

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu b Kulasekara 9 (20b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 45

dismissalComment.html: timber! Kulasekara gets another one to cut back in sharply off the pitch, Taibu stays rooted to the crease, fails to cover the line, gets a thick inside edge and looks back to see his leg stump flattened

he adjusts his line to the offstump and gets an immediate reward, the ball cuts back in off a good length and goes through the gate between bat and pad and crashes on to the middle and offstumps, Sibanda goes for the off drive but fails to cover the line

funny old shot by Masakadza, he gets his front pad across the stumps, bends his knee and tries to slog him across the line but the ball cuts back in and hits him in line with the stumps, Doctrove raises the finger

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: timber! Kulasekara gets another one to cut back in sharply off the pitch, Taibu stays rooted to the crease, fails to cover the line, gets a thick inside edge and looks back to see his leg stump flattened

dismissalComment.html: and Mendis is the fastest to 50 wickets in ODIs! Price gives him the charge but is beaten all ends up to a delivery which is pitched a fraction short and straightens, Sangakkara effects one of the easiest stumpings

it's all over, Mupariwa gets on his knee early to slog him away but he fails to get the desired elevation and finds Tharanga at deep midwicket, easy take and Zimbabwe are bowled out for less than 100 for the 4th time against Sri Lanka

dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Jayawardene b Mathews 8 (16b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Jayawardene hangs on to it brilliantly, he pokes out and edges a delivery whuch seams away, Jayawardene stations himself at wide first slip and he flings himself to his right and pulls it off one-handed

dismissalText.commentary: Keith Dabengwa c Jayawardene b Muralidaran 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 'It was that easy guys' -that's what Jayawardene appears to gesture to the fielders as he takes an easy catch at first slip, Murali delivers from over the wicket and Dabengwa tamely fishes at it and fails to cover the turn

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Tawanda Mupariwa c Tharanga b Mendis 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: it's all over, Mupariwa gets on his knee early to slog him away but he fails to get the desired elevation and finds Tharanga at deep midwicket, easy take and Zimbabwe are bowled out for less than 100 for the 4th time against Sri Lanka

commentPostTextItems.html: Sri Lanka storm home by 130 runs. Quite a walkover really after Zimbabwe wobbled to Kulasekara early on. Some of the indiscreet shots gave the impression that they had given up already.
Mendis beat Ajit Agarkar's record for the fastest to 50 ODI wickets. Agarkar did it in 23 games but Mendis managed it in just 19. And he has an average of 10.
Stay with us for the presentation.
Sld, from United States: "Another typical outing by Zimbabwe and clinical thrashing by Sri Lanka. Well at least you guys get to enjoy the rest of the day and I can go to sleep early."
Utseya: "We didn't put up a fight. No excuses for the way we played. The bowling has been good. The batsmen should apply themselves a bit more."

Jayawardene: "The toss does play a crucial part for the 9am start. Angelo, Mubarak and Tharanga guided us through the difficult period. The wicket surprises us everyday. It played differently in the morning. "
Angelo Mathews is the Man of the Match: He says: "When I went out to bat the wicket was doing a bit. I've played on these types of wickets of before. I'm thankful to the seniors."

So Sri Lanka have gained a bonus point. Zimbabwe have four and Bangladesh will be under immense pressure to beat Sri Lanka convincingly on Wednesday to give themselves a shot at the final. That's it from us. Do join us on the 14th for the final league game. Cheers!

commentTextItems.html: comes on straight, he defends it away
drifts in to the right-hander and he blocks it away off the meat of the bat

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara lbw b Rainsford 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: the bowling change works! Absolutely plumb, it lands on a good length on middle and off and straightens, he shapes to whips it to the on side but the ball clips the flap of the back pad, very easy decision

headshotImage.caption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c †Taibu b Rainsford 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Jayawardene's miserable run against Zimbabwe continues, the ball lands just a shade outside off and forces him to play at it, he gets a thick outside edge and Taibu dives low to his right and pouches it comfortably

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Kapugedera lbw b Rainsford 4 (7b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 57.14

dismissalComment.html: It's a double-strike for Rainsford, he gets it to come back in off the pitch and Kapugedera gets a half stride forward to defend, he stands outside his crease but the ball does enough to hit him in line with the stumps, Enamul Haque Moni raises the finger

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga lbw b Utseya 43 (56b 6x4 0x6 99m) SR: 76.78

dismissalComment.html: lands it outside off and gets it to come in with the angle, he is a little lazy on the forward defense and hence fails to get his bat behind the line of the ball, he's hit in line with the offstump, another bowling change works and it's the captain himself

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jehan Mubarak player page headshot cutout, 2021

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Jehan Mubarak c Williams b Price 31 (62b 3x4 0x6 84m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Mubarak takes his chances soon after taking the Powerplay, he gives him the charge and scoops it high over mid-on but fails to get the desired elevation to clear the boundary and Williams takes it easily and falls to his right after taking the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza lbw b Kulasekara 3 (22b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 13.63

dismissalComment.html: funny old shot by Masakadza, he gets his front pad across the stumps, bends his knee and tries to slog him across the line but the ball cuts back in and hits him in line with the stumps, Doctrove raises the finger

dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda b Kulasekara 7 (16b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 43.75

dismissalComment.html: he adjusts his line to the offstump and gets an immediate reward, the ball cuts back in off a good length and goes through the gate between bat and pad and crashes on to the middle and offstumps, Sibanda goes for the off drive but fails to cover the line

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Stuart Matsikenyeri b Mendis 15 (29b 1x4 0x6 59m) SR: 51.72

dismissalComment.html: terrible shot really, he commits to the front foot and tries to slog him across the line very early, the ball shoots through and hits the middle and leg stumps

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Tatenda Taibu
image.longCaption: Tatenda Taibu portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Tatenda Taibu b Kulasekara 9 (20b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 45

dismissalComment.html: timber! Kulasekara gets another one to cut back in sharply off the pitch, Taibu stays rooted to the crease, fails to cover the line, gets a thick inside edge and looks back to see his leg stump flattened

headshotImage.caption: Thilan Thushara  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Thilan Thushara  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Thushara 8 (15b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 53.33

dismissalComment.html: gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Prosper Utseya c Jayawardene b Mathews 8 (16b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Jayawardene hangs on to it brilliantly, he pokes out and edges a delivery whuch seams away, Jayawardene stations himself at wide first slip and he flings himself to his right and pulls it off one-handed

headshotImage.caption: Keith Dabengwa player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Keith Dabengwa player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Keith Dabengwa player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Keith Dabengwa player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Keith Dabengwa c Jayawardene b Muralidaran 6 (12b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 'It was that easy guys' -that's what Jayawardene appears to gesture to the fielders as he takes an easy catch at first slip, Murali delivers from over the wicket and Dabengwa tamely fishes at it and fails to cover the turn

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura st †Sangakkara b Muralidaran 6 (25b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 24

dismissalComment.html: comes round the wicket and delivers the doosra, the turn beats the outside edge and he lunges forward but fails to drag his foot back in time, Sangakkara is sharp enough to whip off the bails in a flash

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Ray Price
image.longCaption: Ray Price portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ray Price st †Sangakkara b Mendis 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: and Mendis is the fastest to 50 wickets in ODIs! Price gives him the charge but is beaten all ends up to a delivery which is pitched a fraction short and straightens, Sangakkara effects one of the easiest stumpings

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tawanda Mupariwa c Tharanga b Mendis 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: it's all over, Mupariwa gets on his knee early to slog him away but he fails to get the desired elevation and finds Tharanga at deep midwicket, easy take and Zimbabwe are bowled out for less than 100 for the 4th time against Sri Lanka

headshotImage.longCaption: Ed Rainsford player page headshot cutout, 2021

notes: Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 8.3 overs, 41 mins (61 balls), Extras 17
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 61 balls (WU Tharanga 12, ST Jayasuriya 22, Ex 17)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 73/2 in 13.4 overs (WU Tharanga 29)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 22.1 overs, 107 mins (146 balls), Extras 20
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 135/5 in 33.0 overs (J Mubarak 17, AD Mathews 20)
6th Wicket: 50 runs in 86 balls (J Mubarak 19, AD Mathews 27, Ex 5)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 34.4 overs, 150 mins (222 balls), Extras 25
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 48.1 overs, 204 mins (304 balls), Extras 26
AD Mathews: 50 off 94 balls (1 x 4, 2 x 6)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 17.6 overs, 75 mins (109 balls), Extras 6

stories.title: Kulasekara, Mendis demolish Zimbabwe
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v Zimbabwe, Tri-Series, 2nd match, Mirpur
stories.summary: A fine display from Ed Rainsford and a disciplined performance from the spinners helped Zimbabwe restrict Sri Lanka to 210 in the second match of the Tri-Nation Tournament in Bangladesh
